_header: Over all gates that I have gone
_description: ‘The Ivy-tre’ — nine quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘Nowell nowell ell ell / I pray yow lystyn qwat I yow [tell]’

CamStJohn259.First Lines:
Ouer all gatis that I haff goneAmonge þe grovys so fayer &
                    grene…
CamStJohn259.Last Lines:
…I pray ȝow tent qwat I ȝow tellAnd love well Ivy
                    euery schon
CamStJohn259.Note: End of burden destroyed by tear.
CamStJohn259.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes,  and  G. C. Macaulay, eds.  
             “Fifteenth Century Carols and Other Pieces.” 
             Modern Language Review
         8 (1913): 68-87: 83-4.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 95-6; 1977, 83-4.
